channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Longtime Cracker Barrel foe urges shareholders to vote against ‘worse than mediocre’ CEO after dismal earnings
item.description: "The Company has become a laughingstock," wrote the CEO of Steak 'n Shake and Biglari Holdings, which also controls Maxim magazine.

item.title: First Kimmel, then Fallon and Meyers? A veteran TV scholar says late night can’t survive politics anymore — and today’s hosts must ‘tread carefully’
item.description: “We may be coming full circle," Robert Thompson of Syracuse University told Fortune, "back to a Carson-style, harmless late night—with NBC the last on...

item.title: What Jimmy Kimmel’s Suspension Says About the Trump Administration’s Crackdown Against Mainstream Media
item.description: ABC’s decision to “indefinitely” suspend Jimmy Kimmel’s late-night talk show illuminates the administration’s efficacy so far.

item.title: 11 Elected Officials Arrested While Trying to Access Cells at N.Y.C. ICE Facility
item.description: Brad Lander, the city comptroller, was arrested again. Jumaane D. Williams, the public advocate, was among protesters detained outside.

item.title: President Obama accuses the Trump administration of ‘government coercion’ after ABC takes Jimmy Kimmel off the air
item.description: The 44th U.S. president said media companies need to stand up instead of cave.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg blames bad Wi-Fi after the live demo of his new $800 smart glasses goes horribly wrong
item.description: Critics are raving about Meta's new wearables. But Zuckerberg’s live demo of the $799 Ray-Ban Display was a pretty big flop.

item.title: Trump says Charlie Kirk could have become president as Obama rips Kimmel suspension taking ‘cancel culture’ to a ‘new and dangerous level’
item.description: Columbia's Alex Abdo said Brendan Carr of the FCC is close to “the definition of unconstitutional coercion" while Chuck Schumer called his rhetoric "d...

item.title: In Their Own Words: Trump and Top Officials Change Tone on Free Speech
item.description: In the wake of Charlie Kirk’s assassination, the president’s pledges to guarantee free speech have been replaced by efforts to suppress — and even cri...

item.title: The Era of Dark Passions
item.description: Leaders across the political spectrum have figured out how easily they can motivate people with anger, fear and domination.

item.title: At U.K. Leader’s Country House, Trump’s State Visit Gets a Little More Political
item.description: Photographs of the pomp and spectacle of the U.S. president’s second state visit to Britain.

item.title: Drones vs. Lasers
item.description: My colleague Lara Jakes tells us about Russian drones and the math problem facing NATO — and one possible solution.

item.title: Maps: 7.8-Magnitude Earthquake Off Russia Prompts Brief Tsunami Advisory in Alaska
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Rifts Grow Between Netanyahu and His Security Chiefs
item.description: As Israel expands its war in Gaza, decision-making has become increasingly concentrated in the hands of one person: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

item.title: Assailant Kills 2 Israeli Soldiers at West Bank-Jordan Border
item.description: Israel’s military said the attacker crossed the border in a truck transporting aid. He was armed with a gun and a knife, initially opening fire and th...

item.title: Catholics Project Many Images Onto Pope Leo: Liberal? Conservative? Cubs Fan?
item.description: Unlike Francis, Leo XIV has given few clues about where he stands on issues dividing the church (though he’s definitely a White Sox guy). Followers fi...
